questions.question_title:
A large organization will transform from a predictive environment to agile methodologies. In its current state, the work in the organization is decomposed into departmental silos, and the employees are best described as specialized contributors.
What is the best strategy for this agile transformation?
questions.feedback: A large and complex organization will likely require a gradual approach to transition from predictive to agile methodologies. Incorporating elements of agile within the existing predictive framework will allow for the gradual adoption and acceptance of agile methods.

questions.question_title: Drag the agile Ceremonies on the left to the main subject discussed during the event, on the right.
questions.feedback:
(   Iteration Review) A four-hour timebox event held at the end of the sprint. The team demonstrates the product/changes to customers and gathers feedback on what to incorporate in the product backlog for delivery in subsequent sprints. so the correct answer is : Backlog items completed or not.... 
( Iteration Planning) Meeting is conducted before the start of a sprint. where the team decides what to deliver in the coming sprint (from the product backlog) and how to go about it and the Goal for this Iteration set. 
( Iteration retrospective	) A three-hour timebox event held after the sprint review (and before the next sprint planning). The team reviews their work, identifying opportunities for improvement work processes in subsequent sprints. so the correct answer is : Continue, stop, or start actions	.
( Daily meeting	) A 15-minute timebox (commonly referred to as daily stand up) where the team meets daily during the sprint to inspect progress and identify blockers. the correct answer is : Development flow	.

questions.feedback_fr: (Revue d'itération ) Un événement d'une durée de quatre heures (timebox )qui se tient à la fin du sprint. L'équipe fait une démonstration du produit/des changements aux clients et recueille des retours d'information sur ce qui doit être incorporé dans le backlog de produit pour être livré dans les sprints suivants. La réponse correcte est donc :  Éléments du backlog complétés ou non.... (Planification dl'itération) Réunion qui a lieu avant le début d'un sprint, où l'équipe décide de ce qu'elle va livrer au cours du prochain sprint (à partir du backlog de produit) et comment s'y prendre, et où l'objectif de cette itération est défini.  (Rétrospective du sprint) Événement de trois heures (timebox) qui se tient après la revue du sprint (et avant la planification du sprint suivant). L'équipe passe en revue son travail, identifiant les opportunités d'amélioration des processus de travail dans les sprints suivants. La réponse correcte est donc :  Continuer, arrêter ou démarrer les actions. ( Réunion quotidienne ) Un intervalle de temps de 15 minutes (timebox) (communément appelé dailystand up) où l'équipe se réunit quotidiennement pendant le sprint pour inspecter les progrès et identifier les blocages. la bonne réponse est : Le flux de développement .

The ongoing conflict is preventing tasks and deliverables from being completed. The project manager contemplates changing their leadership style. What should the project manager do?
questions.feedback:
Escalate only if any of the following statements match your situation:

  • The issue you are planning to escalate is likely going to cause a delay of the project or an overrun of budget OR
  • The issue is causing significant extra work on your side or on the side of your team members
  • You have already tried different strategies to fix the issue or contain the risk but to no avail
  • You have communicated the issue to the responsible team (or team member)
  • You have tried to find a common solution with the other party involved

In this situation, the conflict occurs at every meeting and preventing tasks and deliverables from being completed.

SO the correct answer is to Escalate the situation to the project sponsor.

questions.question_title:
A company uses a hybrid approach to project management and has just completed the first sprint . A team member provided ideas to improve the testing process during the sprint retrospective.
What is the next step for the project manager?
questions.feedback:
The correct answer is : 

Document the lessons learned and implement improvements in the next sprint.

Sprint Retrospective:   A meeting of the team members facilitated by the Scrum Master for the team to identify its own improvements. Where a Sprint review reviews the product and identified improvements, the retrospective reviews the team's processes and practices and is used to identify ways the team can improve its performance, collaboration.

questions.question_title_fr:
Une entreprise utilise une approche hybride de management du projet et vient de terminer son premier sprint. Un membre de l'équipe a proposé des idées pour améliorer le processus de test pendant la rétrospective du sprint.
Quelle est la étape suivante pour le chef de projet ?
questions.feedback_fr:
La réponse correcte est :

Documenter les retours d'expérience (Lessons learned) et mettre en œuvre les améliorations dans le prochain sprint.

Rétrospective du sprint : Une réunion des membres de l'équipe facilitée par le Scrum Master pour que l'équipe identifie ses propres améliorations. Alors que la revue de sprint passe en revue le produit et les améliorations identifiées, la rétrospective passe en revue les processus et les pratiques de l'équipe et est utilisée pour identifier les moyens par lesquels l'équipe peut améliorer ses performances et sa collaboration.

questions.question_title:
A project has recently Kicked off. The project manager observes that there are different expectations among the project team members. These growing misunderstandings are affecting team productivity.
Which document should the project manager use as a guide to resolve the issue?
questions.feedback:
Team charter: A document that enables the team to establish its values, agreements, and practices as it performs its work together.

A good team charter includes:

- The team's shared values.

- Guidelines for team communications and the use of tools.

- How the team makes decisions.

- How the team resolves conflicts when disagreements arise.

- How and when the team meets.

Other team agreements (such as shared hours, improvement activities).
